Keywords: S.H.I.E.L.D. , Spy , X-Men
Real Name: Logan
Special Powers
TRACKING THE TARGET: At the beginning of the game, choose an opposing character as Wolverine's Mark. Whenever that character moves, after resolutions you may move Wolverine up to 2 squares. // At the beginning of your turn, if no opposing character on the map is Wolverine's Mark, choose an opposing character to be Wolverine's Mark.
SILENTLY STALKING: Wolverine can’t be targeted until he has made an attack this game or is adjacent to his Mark.
I HEAL… DO YOU?: When Wolverine hits, after resolutions he may use Regeneration as FREE.
Figure Errata
Changed TRACKING THE TARGET

January 27, 2022
tidge
Don't let "the Mark" confuse you. There are 2 different effects: one is the ability to move on an opponent's turn, the other is the inability to be targeted by opponents. If Wolverine attacks, he forever loses the "immunity" to being targeted by opponents. If he never attacks, he can only be targeted while adjacent to his Mark. Once the "immunity" to being targeted is gone, it is forever gone. A new Mark simply allows him to keep the ability to move on an opponent's turn.
January 27, 2022
Disasstah
how he works? 1-if he hasn't attacked and he isn't adjacent to his marker he can't be target - Yes 2-if he hasn't attacked and he is adjacent to his marker he can't be target - No he can be targeted 3-if he has attacked and he isn't adjacent to his marker can he can be targeted - Yes 4-if he has attacked and he is adjacent to his marker he can't be target. - No, he can be targeted I think this is the way like he works. is it correct? Fixed the grammar and spelling and added some answers. If he attacks anyone he can then be targeted after the attack resolves. If that attack is against his mark, then he can be targeted before or during the attack so long as he's adjacent to his mark. If he's next to his mark he can be targeted.

January 5, 2022
Disasstah
[QUOTE=The Singularity;12175016]@ Disasstah - That was really helpful. Thank you 😀[/QUOTE] Anytime! There are other abilities that trigger at the start of game though, so don't confuse the two. Characters with equipment usually fall in this area but some others have the "start" in the wording. 8.1b “Starts the Game” Triggered Effect Some game effects trigger when a character starts the game. This occurs when a character is first added to the map, which could be during game setup, from outside the game, from the Sideline, or when swapped in for another character.

January 4, 2022
Disasstah
[QUOTE=The Singularity;12174658]So if I bring this guy into a game via Agent May's Recruiter S.H.I.E.L.D. trait - can I still choose a Mark?[/QUOTE] Short answer, no. Here's why. Wolverines Trait: Special Tracking the Target: At the beginning of the game, choose an opposing character as Wolverine’s Mark. Whenever that character moves, after resolutions you may move Wolverine up to 2 squares. // If Wolverine’s Mark is KO’d, choose a different opposing character to be a new Mark. 4.4 Step 4: Resolve “Beginning of Game” Triggered Effects Before the first player takes their first turn, both players resolve all effects that trigger “at the beginning of the game.” Effects that trigger during the “beginning of game” step only get one opportunity to trigger and resolve. Game elements with such effects must be on your force and on the map during this specific step in order to trigger and resolve. If a game element has an effect that triggers during the “beginning of game” step, but enters the game after that step has passed, that effect will not trigger.

Disasstah
A much better and cheaper version of the old Wolverine/X-23 duo piece. Pretty sure his Silent Stalking trait includes friendlies, so don't cheat and perplex him up before he triggers his trait! This guy is certain to give your opponent fits as you use him to block line of fire for your approaching team, tie up non-marked characters, and probably end up with some nerd making him the Herald of Galactus, (hi mom) and on the same team as HoX Emma Frost just to make him that much harder to kill and can be brought back by Krakoan Revival. Enjoy!
